page.topic: How to set the Background of an Ink Control
page.description: You can set the background image shown in the ink control to anything you want - either by specifying the URL or the base64 encoded data for an image.
page.discussion: Images can be used as a background for the ink control. Using the <inkObject>.setBackground() method, you can set the background to an image URL or a base64 encoded image. For example,

section.example: var inkControl = {dialog.object}.getControl('INK1'); inkControl.setBackground({ image: { data: url} });

section.description: Watch the video below, which demonstrates setting the background of an Ink control to an image using an image stored in AmazonS3. The video also demonstrates how to set the background to a map, which is generated as a base64 encoded image using the [A5.map.staticMap method].
